author: R Savalia
text: 'Great spot that was fairly empty on a weekday night. It‚Äôs BYOB for free and even has some outdoor seating.'

author: Shail Lakhani
text: 'Very authentic Italian food with a great ambience! Loved every dish! Would recommend the bolognese
column5: perfect balance of flavours. For dessert
column6: it‚Äôs one of the better tiramisu‚Äôs that I have had. It is a byob place
column7: so make sure you bring your wine along! The staff are very friendly and will give you amazing recommendations. Would go back here for sure!'

author: Ilva Mane
text: 'Spinach Ravioli - an out of this world experience!!! Look no further for true authentic Italian foodü§§ü§§'

author: totof z
text: 'Best pizza in the USA I have had! As good as in Italy...wonderful pasta and anything else really.\nGood pricing plus a BYOB and wine with no charge.... place to go in Hoboken for sure'

author: Cyr & Associates
text: 'I‚Äôve been here a few times now and I‚Äôm impressed. One of the better Hoboken Italian spots. It‚Äôs authentic
column5: fresh ingredients
column6: and clean.\n\nI would recommend the seafood fried platter to begin. Calamari
column7: shrimp
column8: and peppers. I only have one gripe
column9: no tentacles but hey still amazing and plentiful. I‚Äôve had similar starters at many other area restaurants and theirs is ‚Äúthe best.‚Äù\n\nFor entrees
column10: their pasta dishes or the Branzino are also quite good. We‚Äôve had the fusilli with shrimp in a cream sauce. You will not be disappointed.\n\nThey are BYOB
column11: liquor store on next block is a hop. Just a nice relaxing meal with beautifully presented plates and service.'

author: Vladislava Kursheva

text: 'Thank you for excellent dinner. I enjoyed it a lotüëç'

author: Emily Ng
text: 'The food was pretty good but I asked for bread three times and never got it. We were also rushed out just like the other reviewers'

author: azza moore
text: 'Good food... TERRIBLE service. It felt nearly impossible to get them on the phone. My boyfriend needed to see if his card was left there
column5: and no pick up after calling 5 times. Also had us standing inside for about 15 minutes for a pick up order that was ready. Not to mention it was extremely extremely packed
column6: it was not COVID safe at all. And I wasn‚Äôt even dining in.'

author: Allison
text: 'I have no complaints
column5: the food is always great quality
column6: the service is amazing and they make you feel very welcome and are accommodating when they can be. BYOB
column7: always a big fan! Of top 5 Italian spots I‚Äôve tried in nyc / JC. Would suggest going in rather than delivery.'

author: Robert Napolitano
text: 'Excellent food and service nice atmosphere will definitely come back'

author: Adriano Colicchio
text: 'Very good napoletan pizza would have given 5 stars if not for the price
column5: too high for a pizza to go and for the delivery because pizzas arrived cold and we only live 5 minutes drive from the restaurant'

author: Deanna Cho
text: 'Horrible customer service. Had a reservation and the host disregarded our reservation and sat other parties while saying ‚Äúour table was next‚Äù although other parties had wait times after ours. Ended up leaving after half an hour of being skipped. Never coming here again.'

author: G. Lee
text: '120% capacity here. If you are worried about being with so many people in a crowded place with not even ventilation I would not recommend. The food was out after about 55min of wait.'

author: Anna Johnson
text: 'Great place
column5: good food and amazing service by Danny üå∏'

author: Dev Chatterjee
text: "Quality of the food was great. The service
column5: specifically the front door man wasn't the best.  The night we went it was quite busy
column6: although we had a reservation
column7: we had a significant wait
column8: and although I understand awaiting tables to finish up
column9: the front doorman was rather rude.  The service afterwords got better yet although did seemed rushed. it gets quite overwhelming on the weekends.   BYOB."

author: Max Setton
text: 'This is the first time I‚Äôm leaving a bad review for a restaurant. The manager rushed my whole meal because I was 4 minutes late to my reservation. He made my meal very uncomfortable. When I confronted him
column5: he was very rude. I wouldn‚Äôt let my dog eat here. Pizza was solid but soggy
column6: everything else was mediocre.'

author: Alex Corrado
text: 'Danny was a Great Host
column5: and the food was outstanding ! üëçüá∫üá∏üáÆüáπ'

text: 'Very nice place!!! Great Service!!! food was amazing I can‚Äôt wait to come back
column5: my favorite are the pappardelle and the burrata but the pizza is also delicious ü§§'

author: Sonia Grover
text: 'The staff was so rude. BTW it‚Äôs 1 hour dining limit just FYI because no one told us from the get-go'

author: Ariella Davidson
text: 'Food and was delicious. Found this place just wandering around. I would go back again.'

author: Tabatha Goloborodko
text: 'Love this hidden gem! The best fresh pasta and meatballs in Hoboken. wonderful staff!'

author: Lina Gomez
text: 'The food was good. The servers were nice. Unfortunately we had the pleasure to seat with what seemed to be the owners? Or I don‚Äôt know maybe the owner‚Äôs sons with their three girl friends being super loud and obnoxious and then proceeding to talk about us the only other people in the restaurant in another language like we couldn‚Äôt understand. I couldn‚Äôt believe it. Saying we didn‚Äôt know how to eat and we didn‚Äôt belong there. I guess you can go for the food but I hope they‚Äôre not there.'

author: Gabrielle Besante
text: 'Charming Italian cuisine with a charming waiter! The spaghetti carbonara was a bit to creamy for my liking but this is good Italian food. Nice for a date night or with a close friend.'

author: Manos Cito
text: 'Best bolognese ever in US. Quaint little place byob!'

author: Anthony Zurbito
text: 'Hip and trendy'

author: Alex Vazquez
text:
'(Translated by Google) Authenticity and quality

(Original)
Autenticidad y calida'

author: Satish Umapathy
text: 'Didn‚Äôt have a great experience. Like many others have written before the server rushed to get our order even when we said we needed some time he returned in a couple of minutes and stood by our table until we ordered. We asked for a small side of pasta for our 20 month old son. Gave us a full size entree portion of pasta instead and charged us $12 for it. They charge extra for using a credit card which nudges people to use cash instead. Not ideal when we are in the midst of a  pandemic. Didn‚Äôt give us the correct change at the end. Bill was 71.24 and we payed $100 in cash. We were only given $24. We didn‚Äôt realize until we were few blocks away and we decided to just let it go. We are not going back.'

author: Rachel Wils
text: 'The absolute worst dining experience. The head waiter is the rudest person I‚Äôve ever encountered. I suggest you hire someone who adds value to your business.. it appears
column5: after reading through your reviews
column6: that many other customers feel the same way!'

author: Beth Cooper
text:
"Drove from Jersey City to Hoboken with my 2 year old child to do get takeout from here because we heard it was good.

I waited  45 minutes for pick-up order in the restaurant with my child & husband waiting in the car. Ended up walking out without getting my food at all. Staff barely acknowledged me the entire time & rude when I asked for updates. By the time I have up and left there were a line of people waiting for takeout.

Don't order takeout from here!!!"

author: kristina rappaport
text: 'First time experience and wasn‚Äôt the best. The server was super pushy in getting our order even though we barely sat down for 2 min. He also stood by our table for a long time on his phone texting. The food portion size of the baked salmon was so tiny (way to much spinach and lack of actual salmon and mashed potatoes). Also
column5: a heads up they don‚Äôt follow the appropriate pandemic rules that are set in Hoboken as they allowed people to dine inside.'

author: Christian Murphy
text: 'The owner was a bit pushy for us to eat there and was trying to get us to buy more food when we didn‚Äôt want any more. The food itself didn‚Äôt have too much flavor to it. And what bothered me the most was that two employees (mostly the owner) didn‚Äôt have their masks on most of the time. The owner even shook hands and hugged a guy. Not the greatest way to handle the pandemic. Especially if you‚Äôre in the Resturant business.'

author: Me Time
text: "One of the first days dining again after the coronavirus pandemic - it was nice to sit outside at this establish. The service was great! Its a BYOB spot and our server kindly removed the cork from the wine bottle for us.\nFor dinner
column5: our party of two had the mussels to start
column6: followed by a pasta dish (squid ink pasta) and a pizza.\nThe food didnt impress me. It didnt seem hot - i dont know if the food is made to order. The squid ink pasta dish was bland. The pizza was fair.\nWould I return? Probably - the service was great
column7: so I'd be willing to give the food another shot."

author: Eric Rodriguez
text: 'Place is great'

author: Jason Frost
text: 'Food was delicious and service was great. Tony is awesome and always super welcoming and quick with service!'

author: Hailey Dugan
text: 'First experience here tonight
column5: and it was disappointing. The food was fine‚Äînot worth the price.  We got a calamari app
column6: a pizza and a truffle pasta. What was truly awful was the service. To sum it up briefly: unprofessional and rude. We were going to order a dessert after our meal but instead they brought us the check and kicked us out as they needed our table (btw the people they were accommodating had come in halfway during our meal to make a reservation‚Äîso they promised them our table). I see
column7: in the reviews I‚Äôm not the only one this has happened to. We were rushed
column8: and not even checked in on during the meal to see if everything was okay. Also
column9: the pizza came out much later than the pasta. It seemed like they forgot about it. And also
column11: the server placed our utensils on the bare table
column12: which I find gross (especially during flu season). Will NOT be returning.'

author: Niccolo Ragazzoni
text: 'True Italian
column5: excellent pizzas and fantastic pasta!'

author: Anthony Abenante
text: 'The best place to eat the food day are'

author: Kathleen Pardalos
text: 'Absolutely fabulous. Tony the owner is charming and incredibly accommodating! The food was delicious!!'

author: Leslie SALEMBIER
text: "Want to visit NOT on Valentines Day. Serve hectic and didn't get my appy until 15 minutes after my other dining guest. Rest of service good. Food good."

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'Wonderful little Italian restaurant with tasty pizza and very friendly servers. Tony is the best! We all got pizzas so next time I go back
column5: I‚Äôll have to try their other entrees and appetizers.'

author: Andrea R.
text: "Came here on a Friday night date at 7 pm. There is no hostess stand when you walk in so we stood in the doorway for a minute or two but then more people started piling in so we went to the back to inquire about our table. When we told a waitress near a computer that we had a reservation
column5: she gave us a frightened look before a waiter called to us from the middle of the restaurant asking what we wanted. Whatever. He seated us and walked away.\n\nWe sat down (to a very crooked table and chairs) and were approximately 6 inches from the table next to us. We then realized the placed was BYOB. This is a plus for me and luckily a liquor store was down the street. Came back and the table as crammed full of giant menus
column6: plates
column7: glasses and bread.\n\nI had no clue who our waiter was at this point since no one came to our table so I asked the waitress to open our wine. She again looked terrified and opened it for us
column8: didn't pour it into the glasses
column9: and practically ran away. Then the waiter who seated us came back and asked if we were ready to order
column10:
which we weren't seeing as we were seated for 5 minutes. He came back 2 minutes later and asked again. I asked if the truffle pasta was dairy-free and he said yes. It wasn't. I should mention that we came for the squid ink pasta as it is on the menu online but it wasn't on the menu in the restaurant.

The saving grace was the food. The pasta with truffles and mushrooms was delicious. The pasta clumped together a bit but the sauce was great and the mushrooms were cooked well. My date ordered the Fiama pizza and really liked it. The pizza was big for one person which was ideal for him while the pasta portion was moderate. A little small for $25 but it was good.

Overall
column12: dark and loud and the staff is terrible but the food is great. I would just order takeout next time."

author: Andrew Price
text: "Regina Margherita pizza was awesome - best pizza in Hoboken. Meatballs were decent (but not worth $18 as an appetizer.) Truffle fries were plain.\n\nThe space is nice
column5: but it's so loud and noisy. We had to make a reservation for Saturday dinner."

author: Russell Kriegel
text: 'Nothing mind blowing
column5: just good food & service.'

author: Emily Wong
text: 'Really great pizza and apps. The risotto was my favorite. The pasta was okay but would def come back. They are byob!'

author: Rokotoff
text: 'The Best Pizza West NY'

author: Daniel McCarthy
text: "I would do zero stars if I could. The waiter was incredibly rude to us. We went at 530 on a Friday night with 7 people. We ordered a bunch of apps and planned on splitting pizzas
column5: our plan was one pizza per 2 people and the waiter would not allow that. He insisted we had one entre or pizza per person
column6: which was outrageous based upon how many apps we ordered. The waiter also rolled his eyes when we asked him to push tables together to accommodate our party. We purposely went early so we wouldn't have to wait
column7: and the restaurant was completely empty. I have been to this restaurant many times
column8: and I was not expecting this horrible service
column9: I will never be coming back to this restaurant and I would tell everyone I know to go to one of the thousand other Italian restaurants in Hoboken
column10: not this dump!!! Avoid this hell hole at all costs!"

author: Lee Schaffer
text: "I have eaten here 3 times and last Saturday I was rushed to order my dinner and was told by the waiter Johnny  that they need our table and you need to order your main course now. At the end as we were finishing our meals the waiter again said you have to leave now because we need you your table. I have never had a rude waiter that forced us out of the restaurant and would not recommend eating here. I was told by Johnny that the owner Domenico would call me and it's been 2 days and never heard from him. I was very upset and not happy the way we were treated. I will not recommended this restaurant to my fiends and will never return."

author: Noah McDermott
text: 'Best Pizza in town!  5 Stars'

author: C C
text: 'The first time I came here I had an older gentleman who was absolutely amazing. We had such a great time that we came back tonight. Tonight from the moment we walked in the waiter did not have our reservation (not a problem)
column5: was very rude and then sat us. The food was the worst and the server matched the quality. I don‚Äôt know what happened
column6: but the staff needs to realize this is Hoboken
column7: and not everyone is from the middle of no where and willing to deal with their little attitudes. Consistency is the key to a great restaurant and unfortunately this one is not consistent.'

author: Matt Meyer
text: 'Restaurant is very nice decor and atmosphere. Staff is very quick to sit you down
column5: take order and rush you out so they can flip the table. Requested well done pizza
column6: came out chewy. Requested meatballs to come with pasta
column7: came out alone before pasta. Tasted great but no need to rush out a dish when we ask for it with our main course. Pasta came out raw. Not al dente
column8: but I could actually taste the hard shell crack in my teeth. On a cold
column10: there were 7 full tables crammed on one side of restaurant while the vacant 7 tables on the other side of restaurant were saved for potential walk-ins. I was able to hear every conversation with the table to the left and right of me
column11: almost close enough to touch elbows.  Used to enjoy the food but they seem like they are trying to squeeze out as many tables as possible as quickly as possible - no need to feel rushed during my meal.'

author: Orit Schwartz
text: "We loved this place. The service was sweet. Makes you want to go back just for the interaction with the man who paid so much attention to us and made our evening memorable. The food was fantastic too. Can't wait to head to Hoboken again and grab dinner at Zero Otto Uno!"

author: Melanie Tam
text: "Came in with a reservation for four on a Friday at 6:15. We didn't want a huge meal so we just ordered a bunch of things to share. We started off with the Cuoppo Fritto (fried calamari
column5: shrimp
column6: cod fish
column7: served with tomato sauce) which was meh. Nothing special about it. There was much shrimp or fish - it was 90% calamari. Next
column8: we had the Genovese pizza (bufala mozzarella
column11: which I really liked. The crust was thin and they didn't skimp on the toppings. I was under the impression that the tomato sauce would be swapped out for pesto
column12: but it was still the tomato sauce base
column14: which I didn't mind. We also ordered the Pappardelle (black truffle and porcini mushrooms) and some kind of seafood pasta that had shrimp
column18: to share. I loved the pappardelle and the huge mushroom flavor. But the seafood pasta missed the mark. The seafood was a bit fishy and the the pasta was a little undercooked.\n\nI came back two weeks later and tried one of their calzones
column19: which was not memorable. So far
column20: it seems the general theme is that half of the items are good and half are meh. It's a hit or a miss. I'd still come back for the pappardelle and the pizza though.\n\nTip - BYOB"

author: Luca De Simone
text: 'Great original Pizza Napoletana in original brick oven. Good service
column5: nice ambiance and not expensive. The best I had in new jersey.'

author: Alex Cohen
text: 'Great food and great vibes. Always enjoy dinner here!'

author: Shallon Gammon
text: "First time we went there we had the meatballs and muscles and they were amazing. The waiter was attentive. Last night we went again and ordered the same thing. The muscles were completely different and not in a good way. I asked the waiter if something had changed and told him they weren't good. He said it was the same cook and same recipe...maybe it was our wine. And walked away.  Waiter is not personable and in fact rude and pushy for a higher sell. We will not be going back."

author: Gregory Hodkinson
text: 'Oh my worst place in hoboken to visit. Not worth your time. Actually give it one star because no opt for zero star. Worst service
column5: worst pizza in town and very rude. When asked for the desert menu the manager replied not today
column6: I need your table
column7: I have alot of people waiting. Here is your check'

author: Becky Bruton
text: 'Food was delicious (although pizza came out cold
column5: which didn‚Äôt make sense because it was the last thing delivered to the table). Service was slow
column6: waited over an out for our meal
column7: which I wouldn‚Äôt mind if someone had communicated that there was a lag in the kitchen
column8: but no communication/apology. Asked for balsamic
column9: never got it. Waiter took plate before I‚Äôd finished eating.'

author: Natalie
text: "This was an excellent Italian restaurant. Everything from the salad to the grilled squid was amazing. They also accommodated us with a party of 14 people very last minute
column5: which was very much appreciated!  It's also BYOB which is always a plus also because there is a liquor store very close by."

author: Adam Hitt
text: 'Incredible restaurant - very friendly owner - amazing food.'

author: Adrienne Choma
text: 'The food is first rate Italian. Like heaven!'

author: Louise SIBILLE
text: 'A little bit disappointed.. We all ordered together
column5: I asked if they had vegan pizza
column6: the owner said it wasn\'t a problem. The first two pizza arrived
column7: but the 2 other arrived 10 minutes later and the vegan one even later with cheese on it.. Of course
column8: it was "just" a server that came to announce it
column9: the owner never came to apologize for his mistake.. It was late and there was no dough left
column10: so the server proposed some pasta. When they arrived
column12: do not expect a crusty pizza that you can hold
column13: it\'s more of a chewy pizza.'

author: Briland Hitaj
text: 'I wish the service was as good as the food!'

author: CHROME INSTITUTE
text: 'Just the worst place the waiter that works on sundays was extremely unpleasant dont waste your money I guess for this reason the place was empty to bad you cant go below a 1 . To the owner of this place just change your waiter this could help pick up business.'

text: "Loved everything about this place. As a NJ native who relocated to DC
column5: I'm always searching for a perfect Neapolitan pizza when I come back home. The Fiamma did not disappoint! Great chewy crust and authentic ingredients. I'll definitely return."

author: Feta Cheese
text: 'Best food

column6: and hospitality‚Äî what more could you ask for?'

text: 'Excellent Food & Service!'

text: 'A great place for pizza and dessert!'

author: Hemnry G
text: 'Good food'

author: Ken Boyar
text: "Excellent pastas and pizza that rival the very best in the Hoboken/ Jersey City area. Eggplant parmesan was a melt in your mouth version. Staff were very nice and it's BYO on top of all that!"

author: CC Mizrahi
text: 'Tasty food but a bit expensive. Service is top notch.'

author: Gregory Pellegrini
text: 'My favorite pizza I have had outside of Italy üáÆüáπ'

author: Lilian Veras
text: 'Great service
column5: amazing food.The recommended wine was perfect. Pizza was so thin and good. Pasta was perfect. Will definitely go back. Everyone enjoyed this restaurant.'

author: Robert
text: 'My and my husband went tonight for dinner
column5: there were 2 table in total they take long time to come and ask for the order not even drinks. We order a cuoppo (it‚Äôs fried calamari and shrimp)
column6: a tagliere vegetables
column7: spaghetti with baby clams and pizza regina Margherita. The cuoppo flavor was just fried oil flavor
column8: on the tagliere mozzarella was acceptable but the zucchini were uneatable super sweet and weird flavor while tomato eggplant were full of garlic so just garlic flavor; the mozzarella on the pizza tasted as expired whole milk flavor so pizza wasn‚Äôt good neither
column9: but the worst course was VONGOLE... the smell of that plate was manure smell and the spaghetti so soft (and as an Italian I asked ‚Äúal dente‚Äù) we taste and we left the whole dish there and I actually complain to the waiter but he was totally careless and he charge that on the check.\nI gave 1 star because wasn‚Äôt possible give 0. Horrible experience.'

author: Dillon Wu
text: 'Bustling little place with really great pizza and pastas!  It could be the best pizza in Hoboken!  Seriously!'

author: Tebo
text: 'Nice Place'

author: F L
text: 'Great Italian restaurant very nice staff. Dominic and sonny are great wish you guys the best of luck and great success.'

author: Art Thomas
text: "We finally made it here for the first time tonight.  The food was very good
column5: excellent presentation also.  I'd be willing to give it five stars even except for the ridiculous sound level.  A table of younger people next to us was basically screaming at each other.  We couldn't hear ourselves talk.  So close to being great
column6: but that's a big negative."

author: Dave Curran
text: "Great food. Careful with your reservations
column5: they may seat other people as they walk in and make you wait but the food is so good (and we didn't have to wait so it was all good). We saw some disappointed people outside
column6: though... it looked cold"

author: Sheldon Braithwaite
text: 'Not sure about the food but
column5: the staff is friendly...'

author: Victor Manuel Gonzalez
text: 'Exelent place
column5: good food and service'

author: Victor Gonzalez
text: 'Nice Italian place with a friendly staff. Food was nice.'

author: Mike Favetta
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent pizza. Right price.

(Original)
Ottimo la pizza. Prezzo giusto.'

author: Sarat Chandra
text: "The place has nice ambience
column5: good food and a very warm friendly service. Highly recommended for good hearty Italian food.\n\nIts a nice
column6: cozy and warm restaurant with good ambience. The restaurant has brick walls with tungsten filament lamps giving a rustic modern look. The service was really great
column7:
the waiting staff was very friendly and explained the dishes patiently. The food was really great with good portion size and reasonable pricing. The menu is vegetarian friendly with at least a couple of vegetarian options for each course and the deserts were to die for.

The restaurant however doesn't serve alcohol and you can BYOB. Fun fact: there is a 7-11 around the corner from where you can pick something quick.

Must tries are:
Appetizer: Caprese Di Bufala (Caprese Salad)
Pasta: Quadrati Con Ricotta E Spinaci (Spinach Ravioli with Lemon butter sauce)
Pizza: Regina Margherita
Desserts: Tiramisu or Chocolate Hazelnut Cream"

author: Lakshya Bhat
text: 'Fresh and delicious food. Authentic Italian restaurant. Deserts are out of the world. Ambience is soothing and gives you an italian vibe. Will surely visit this place again.'

author: Giselle Montalbano
text: "My boyfriend and I went for the first time to Zero Otto Uno Cafe today in Hoboken for our anniversary and we had a very unpleasant experience with the chef. I ordered a pasta dish with clams and when I received the dish
column5: the food was cold and most importantly the clams were not good
column6: tasted bad and were full of sands. I kindly explained the waiter the situation who took the clams away from the dish and suggested they will send me new clams while my pasta dish was sitting on my table getting cold
column7: with no clams in it. I asked I would prefer to order a pizza instead since my food was going to get cold and with no clams on it. When we asked for the check we noticed they charged us for the dish I didn't even eat. I asked for a manager and the chef came out with an unpleasant attitude saying that the clams were good and
column9: I had to pay for it. I explained to him how sandy and old the clams tasted. He ignored me by saying that he did not care about my opinion
column10: whether that I liked it or not. Once again he said: I cooked it and I liked it
column11: so you pay for it.... It was embarrassing and disgraceful how the chef at this restaurant treats his customers and verbally embarrass them. Not only the food was not good but the worse part of whole experience was to witness how a chef can have such an disrespectful attitude towards his customers."

author: Kristin Schaffner
text: 'AMAZING food and great ambiance.  Coming from someone who only will eat from 3 restaurants in hoboken. Great food!!'

author: Ziyu Tang

column6:
I ordered two pizzas and cost 39 dollars

author: Evan Guarini
text: 'Great find. Everything we ordered was fantastic and the service was great. BYOB as well. Owner has a great personality and makes you feel at home. We had the octopus
column5: boar tagliatelle and a Toscana pizza. Will be going back to try some other options soon.'

author: Hauke Vagts
text: 'Great food
column5: with authentic Italian dishes
column6: including a great thin crust pizza. Octopus is a must try! Also very friendly staff. Check it out!'

author: Jack Silbert
text: 'Went for the first time last night and I loved everything about the place! The atmosphere was warm and inviting. Everything we ordered was delicious: meat and cheese combo platter; octopus appetizer; meatball appetizer (melt in your mouth fresh
column5: perfectly spiced); Buffalo mozzarella + prosciutto pizza (great crust; tomato sauce tasty but not overpowering); desserts (my layered chocolate gelato had a delightful crispiness). BYOB always welcome. Head guy Tony was super friendly
column6: helpful
column7: and funny. A+ all around!'

author: Fred Thompson
text: 'Best pizza out side of Italy hands down!'

author: michael wittenburg
text: "Great authentic Neapolitan fare; pastas and pizzas are equally good
column5: which is not always the case in such restaurants. Fresh ingredients
column6: including prosciutto shaved on the spot; so incredibly tender! Ask about the montanara appetizer
column7: you won't be sorry."

author: Jessica Tocora Miller
text: 'Great for groups & BYOB. Oscar was great
column5: we had him order for us and did an amazing job- great apps
column6: pizza and pasta!'

author: Greg Miller
text: "Great new place in town. We came in and just asked them to throw food at us
column5: and they didn't disappoint. Great Italian food with good people."

author: Joseph Hoelle
text: 'Great TRUE ITALIAN food! Margarita pizza was good

author: Vincenzo Grasso
text: 'Nice people
column5: real ITALIAN food. Molto bravi'

author: Red Dacquel
text: 'I got delivery from this spot and was pleased with my personal pizza. I am now making a note to stop in and try their food in house
column5: I am sure the food will taste even better.'

author: Ryan Kelly
text: "The pizza here is absolutely incredible. My wife and I came here after hearing it opened and fell in love with this place. We had the bucatini and bufala mozzarella pizza and would strongly recommend both dishes! It's also BYOB so feel free to bring a bottle of wine."

author: Diana Ceccarini
text: 'This place is great! Finally a Neapolitan pizza place opens in hoboken. If you like Porta‚Äôs pizza in hoboken you‚Äôll like this! Great job
column5: welcome to the neighborhood! Plus its BYOB!'
